Matchmaking is broken when playing killer. Started with a new season rank and im being matched with red tier players after 2 games, making progressing slow and grindy. The mechanics for the killer are unbalanced if all 4 players are in a voice chat and body block the killer while they are picking up a downed survivor. this is blatantly exploited by top tier players. It is rage inducing to chase a survivor around a loop for 5 minutes while generators are being fixed, to finally down them, to be body blocked 3 times by the other survivors until i drop them. 
If you want a game that rewards toxic behaviour, look no further! otherwise, avoid this steaming turd. I used to love this game, but what a joke it has become.

There's a lot to say about DBD.  First of all, the game is really fun in the beginning (save for some smurfs on both the killer and survivor side, bullying new players).  However, the more and more your rank rises, the more and more toxic and stressful the game becomes. For example, as killer, you have less than a minute before 1 or 2 of your 5 gens gets completed, putting you at an extreme disadvantage.  Snowballing off this point, the devs do not seem to have a clear understanding of their own game.  The must-have perk killers had to run to avoid gens being completed too fast (Hex: Ruin) was nerfed a few months ago, completely shifting the game heavily in the survivor's favor.  This causes many survivors to rank up to high ranks, filling the high rank areas with survivors who could hold M1 most effectively, and not for their ability to avoid or run away from the killer.  Furthermore, the meta shift also made it much easier for really good survivors to rush gens at the beginning of the match, making it extremely difficult (although not impossible) for the killer to kill everyone before the gens are done.  The devs keep making small changes that are good as far as QOL fixes go, but no much needed changes are being made for both survivors and killers alike.
Now that we have game mechanics out of the way, lets move on to the player community.  The most infuriating part of DBD is the toxicity.  While there are both toxic survivors and toxic killers, I notice that toxic behavior is much more common on the survivors side.  Despite what the appearance insinuates about the game, killers are not frightening, all-powerful opponents.  It is extremely easy to bully killers and make it had for the killer to get anything meaningful done.  I find that most of the toxicity among survivors come from players that ONLY play survivor, who do not understand the complexity and difficulty that comes with killer gameplay.  A joke among the killer community is the infamous "Survivor's Guide for Killers" which basically consists of a bunch of things survivor will get angry and toxic about if a killer performs certain actions, run certain perks, or use certain add-ons.  However, there's no "Killer's guide for Survivors", so there's no toxicity for survivors running annoying or over powered perks or using unfair items or add-ons.  Once again, a product of survivor players not understanding killer POV.
Given the gameplay and development issues, along with the toxic community, I have to give this a negative review.  This game is fun, at least for a while.  The problems that come with this game pile on gradually to the point where I find myself playing well, but having no fun because of the stress of the game and/or the toxicity of the survivor gameplay or end-game chat.  If you are looking to play DBD, take note of these points.
1. Don't take the game to seriously, you'll burn yourself out and the game will get less and less fun.
2.  Be sure to play both killer and survivor, that way you know the struggles and strengths that come with both sides
3. Don't be toxic, it can be easy to fall into it with the community, but try not to be part of the problem yourself

Have fun

Pro: bellissimo gameplay, grafica fatta abbastanza bene, interessanti le storie di killers e survivors. Anche se gli obiettivi sono sempre gli stessi non ci si annoia grazie alla possibilità di sbloccare altri perk o provare nuovi personaggi. 

Contro: a volte ci mette molto tempo a trovare una lobby, specialmente da survivor. Alcuni giocatori della comunità di dbd sono tossici, ti sbraitano contro se tiri un pallet quando secondo loro non andava fatto o se non giochi come vogliono loro, alcuni arrivano a bodybloccarti apposta per farti prendere dal killer. Alcuni killer andrebbero migliorati (vedi Legione) ed il gioco è forse leggermente sbilanciato dalla parte dei survivors. 

Tutto sommato è divertente giocarci.

This review is from the perspective of a new player. 

Do I like this game? Yes, yes I do. I bought it while on sale and can say that I've gotten my $8 worth of entertainment. However, one thing that irks me about this game is the locking of certain talents such as BBQ and Chill and Decisive Strikes behind a DLC paywall. It feels as if you want to get the full experience from this game and be on an equal playing field with your fellow players that you need these perks to give you the upper hand. Do the talents I listed make you good? No, but  some call them "crutch perks" and its only taken me 14 hours of game play to figure that the game has some very major flaws.

Pros:
-Fun with friends
-Can be bought for $8 on sale
-Has some iconic horror characters.
-Killer is a very fun experience.

Cons:
-Perks locked behind DLC
-Horrible desync problems (but what game nowadays doesn't have those?)
-Toxic Community
-Dumpster fire map design
-Iconic horror characters are locked behind a paywall/very long grind.
-Cool Costumes? That'll be $10 a piece please.
-Community constantly disagreeing that killer/survivor is OP.

As stated before, is this game fun? Yes, yes it is but don't take it too seriously. There isn't a casual mode and its all ranked, but hey who the hell cares? Your rank is reset every month anyway (to some degree.)

[strike] This game easily has one of the most toxic communities, the game is very easily survivor sided and essentially has to be played in a manner where both killer and survivors don't run 'meta' perks that ruin the fun for others (I'm looking at you decisive strike and No one escapes death) as well as certain addons that ruin the fun(syringe, iridescent hatchet). You basically have to hope everyone in the game signed a treaty to not be an asshole. If all goes well, it can definitely be fun and exciting, outplaying and outsmarting one another. Matchmaking is a coin flip to not get teamates who suicide first hook(you can get hooked up to 2 times and live) or on the other side, a group of SWF(premade group, in which DBD was not designed to be played as). This game is basically your abusive partner, you love them but you hate them and yourself for going back every time after they hurt you, just looking for those memorable moments. Please don't start this shitty relationship.[/strike] 

[spoiler]Play something else, eh, for a week. Try civilization or something. Thats quite a refreshing change. 
This game is a joke, please don't waste your time on it. [/spoiler]

TLDR: Get it. Grindy, but gets a lil better each game.

Still reading? Good... This game has two modes: the "I wanna scare myself for the hell of it" survivor mode and the "I'm gonna hunt you guys for the fun of it" mode.
Survivors don't have it easy in the beginning. The lack of perks, tools, lack of these make you easy targets in the beginning of the few games you play. The more you level up your survivor, the better at "surviving" you'll do. You'll also be given unique abilities exclusive to your survivor to stand out and aid in teamwork. Teamwork IS THE BEST WAY TO WIN THIS GAME. It helps to communicate.
Hunters: It's hide and go seek with a hatchet! Each hunter is unique in abilities, from range attacks, to blinking through walls. Needless to say, so long as you chase, slice, and hurt a bit, you'll get points. Use points to make yourself better, grind a hunter up, you'll be finding people in no time.
Sounds, movement, understanding the area, are all key elements you will need to understand to win the games. Doing this, you're bound to have fun.
I really suggest it to everyone

A game where the hitbox is ridiculous, the connection is even worse, overpowered perks, a toxic community with tunnelers and campers cannot be recommended!

The idea and gameplay in general are good, but the execution is far from being.

Yes, there are many fun and challenging matches, but this only happens when the killer is not very good or when the killer, although very good, is not a tunneler or camper, in other words, a game where it depends on the behavior of ONE player (killer) to be able to be challenging and fun cannot be recommended, and the devs don't care about that, nor do they care about the constant bugs. Even to make a group the headache starts!

Frustration at not achieving the goals is part of any good and challenging game, but in DBD this is quite different, there are simply cases where nothing else could have been done.

And it only says that it is balanced for survivors who do not know how to play killer, as a good killer dominates any game with perks and owerpowered addons, for example, where there is Killer arriving without making a noise, exposing the survivor and with a hit knocking him down, or killers crossing the map in 3 seconds and also with a hit knocking down anyone. If this is balanced my bag is beautiful too!

And I don’t say this based only on my matches, in which the majority were in group on Discord with much more experienced people, but you only have to watch the DBD streams to see that the same thing happens with groups of survivors with more than 3, 4 or 5,000 hours of play, where there is almost always someone fighting with someone or cursing the killer for the above-mentioned. And going up in rank is not difficult, that's not the point, and if you don't mind going through situations like that in the vast majority of matches, enjoy the game!

Despite these things who can have fun in a game like that congratulations!

Ainda penso que dead by daylight deveria ter uma campanha pelo menos com assassinos de inteligência artificial e ao menos mais punição pra assassinos que camperam os sobreviventes no gancho. O jogo desde que comprei foi bem atualizado em seus gráficos, servidores e afins. Parece que me ouviram (claro, eu não sou a última bolacha do pacote e eu sei disso) em relação a tudo que eu reclamei desde aquela última análise. Mudaram o sistema de ranks e balancearam bastante os perks, não vi até agora algo op que me impediu de jogar de killer ou de survivor, foram partidas super balanceadas e divertidas depois de tempos que passei raiva até desinstalar o game.

O jogo é estilo PAYDAY 2: pague o jogo base e se quiser mais, pague por esse conteúdo picado também. Na minha opinião as DLC's são bem feitas e que valem a pena cada centavo.
